page.syntax: Result as P = indexes_match_defstring(C tablename ,C indexDefString )

argument.name: Result
argument.description: A pointer variable that contains the result. Result has the following properties:

item.name: .MissingIndexTags
item.description: A CR-LF delimited list of index tags that are missing from the table. The format is the same as Index_Definitions.

item.name: .AdditionalIndexTags
item.description: A CR-LF delimited list of index tags that have been added to the table. Format is same as Index_Definitions.

argument.name: tablename
argument.description: The name of the table containing the indexes.

argument.name: indexDefString
argument.description: The index definitions as created by GET_INDEX_DEFINITIONS().

page.description: Checks if a table's indexes match a Definition string (a crlf string of form Tagname|OrderExpn|FilterExpn|Flags). The definition string is typically created using Get_Index_Definitions(). Returns a pointer with these properties: Error (.t. or .f.), AdditionalIndexTags (tags in the table not in the index def), MissingIndexTags (tags in the index def, but not in the table).
page.discussion: The INDEXES_MATCH_DEFSTRING() function checks the indexes in a table and compares them against a previously created index definition string. Allows you to tell if index tags are missing, or if index tags have been added. Used in conjunction with GET_INDEX_DEFINITIONS()and CREATE_INDEXES(), this function allows you to re-create the indexes for a table if they no longer match the required indexes.
page.example: DIM indexDef as C indexDef = get_index_definitions("customer") ? def = Company|COMPANY|| Customer_Id|CUSTOMER_ID|| Customer_Id_Unique|CUSTOMER_ID||U Lastname|LASTNAME+FIRSTNAME|| Lastname1|LASTNAME||

section.description: Now edit the customer table, adding a new index tag on the bill_state_region field, and dropping the lastname1 index tag.
Recreate the indexes in the customer table so that they match the index definitions stored in indexDef.
Check to see what indexes the customer table has.
section.example: ? get_index_definitions("customer") = Company|COMPANY|| Customer_Id|CUSTOMER_ID|| Customer_Id_Unique|CUSTOMER_ID||U Lastname|LASTNAME+FIRSTNAME|| Lastname1|LASTNAME||
